radiographic_examinations.findings: dilatation of the proximal aorta with a luminal flap; cardiac structure and function were otherwise normal
extensive aortic root dissection, extending from the sinotubular junction to the brachiocephalic trunk, sparing the coronary sinuses and arch branches
rest of the aorta to be of normal size; diffuse arterial elongations and tortuosities most apparent in the carotid, vertebral, and basilar territories
